title: Tesla shares gain on plans to launch full self-driving in Europe, China
content: Tesla shares increased by 2.5% after the company confirmed plans to launch its Full Self-Driving software in China and Europe, pending regulatory approval. This announcement comes ahead of the unveiling of Tesla's robotaxi product, Cybercab. CEO Elon Musk expects regulatory approval for FSD in these regions by year-end.

title: How India can leverage biofuels to build a sustainable future
content: Derived from renewable resources such as biomass and agricultural waste, biofuels provide a cleaner alternative to conventional fossil fuels in our energy palettes, for meeting needs, whether it is surface mobility, aviation, shipping, or even power production. Today, it is possible to leverage bioenergy to fuel each of these energy needs and that also with lower permanent emissions. India has achieved an avoidance of as much as 1.5 tonnes of GHG emissions per kilolitre of bio-ethanol replacing petrol in our cars, amounting to more than 40 million tonnes of savings in GHG emissions over the last decade.

title: Volvo Cars looks to Nvidia-powered software, 'megacastings' for future EVs
content: Volvo Cars will use a single software system powered by Nvidia chips for all future models and employ megacastings to reduce costs for electric vehicles. Starting with the EX90 model, this approach aims to enhance safety systems and allow over-the-air updates, without focusing on subscription services.

title: Revolutionising road safety with AI: India eyes ADAS technology to slash road accidents
content: The rising percentage of road crashes in the country is alarming for the government of India, OEMs (Original equipment manufacturers), regulatory bodies, and other players, who need to address the concern. The heavy use of the latest technologies in the automotive sector might be a ray of hope to curb such incidents. Implementing artificial intelligence such as ADAS in vehicles might bring a paradigm shift toward safer vehicles.

title: Gadkari asks state FM's to consider reducing GST on flex-fuel vehicles to 12 %
content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari urged state finance ministers to reduce GST on flex-fuel vehicles to 12%. He emphasized the need to cut fossil fuel imports and boost biofuel use. Currently, GST rates stand at 28% for combustion engine vehicles and 5 percent for electric ones, Gadkari highlighted the potential benefits for agriculture and job creation.

title: Air taxis to rule skies soon, revolutionise urban travel
content: India is set to become the largest market for electric air taxis by 2026, as announced by Nikhil Goel of Archer Aviation. title: Vjaitra Air Mobility teams with Trouvé Innovation Hub for hydrogen air taxi prototype

title: Govt scraps GPS tracker fee for public vehicle owners
content: The Delhi government has exempted commercial passenger vehicle owners from paying the annual fee for vehicle location tracking devices. This move, benefiting approximately 1.5 lakh public vehicle owners, aims to reduce their financial burden while enhancing passenger safety. The National Informatics Centre will now handle real-time vehicle tracking and monitoring using these devices.

title: Veera Vahana and Exponent Energy unveil world's first 15-minute charging intercity electric bus - Veera Mahasamrat EV
content: Veera Vahana has collaborated with Exponent Energy to introduce the world's first 15-minute charging intercity bus, the Veera Mahasamrat EV. Equipped with a 320 kWh battery, it offers a sustainable alternative to diesel buses on long routes. The initiative begins on the Bengaluru-Hyderabad route with four 1 MW charging stations.

title: Ashok Leyland unveils GARUD 15M: India's first front engine multi-axle bus chassis
content: Ashok Leyland, the flagship of the Hinduja Group, has introduced India’s first front engine multi-axle bus chassis, GARUD 15M, at Prawaas 4.0. title: Varroc appoints Dr. Karl-Heinz Glander as Head of R&D for Business II
content: Varroc has appointed Dr. Karl-Heinz Glander as the Head of R&D for Business II. Dr. Glander, based in Germany, will oversee the development of advanced automotive technologies such as ADAS and DMS. His role aims to strengthen Varroc's innovation and competitive edge. He brings 20 years of experience in the automotive sector.
